title: Gang of burglars pretending to be policemen target elderly homeowners 29 times in 10 days
text:
A gang of burglars pretending to be policemen have targeted elderly homeowners 29 times in 10 days, authorities have revealed.

The violent group have targeted elderly residents and threatened to spray unknown liquids into their faces or smash them with bricks.

After forcing their way inside their homes "with brute force", the victims - in their 70s and 80s - are ordered to hand over cash and jewellery.

Police are warning elderly people to be on their guard after 29 pensioners have been robbed in their homes across the Black Country since October 8.

Today four men aged between 20 and 43 were arrested in connection with the raids.

A number of break-ins have taken place in Sandwell, Dudley, Walsall and Wolverhampton.

Masked men struck in Penn Fields, Wolverhampton, where they barged into the home of a 75-year-old woman before stealing her jewellery.

In Walsall, a man posed as a police officer to trick his way inside the home of a 87-year-old woman before snatching jewellery and cash from her bedroom.

In another shocking raid, one elderly woman suffered a heart attack following the terrifying robbery.

The gang are believed to have been caught on a camera at a house in Coseley on Wednesday night.
